item.title: Publications
item.description: Works attributed to Seneca include a dozen philosophical essays, one hundred and twenty-four letters dealing with moral issues, nine tragedies, and a satire, the attribution of which is disputed. His authorship of Hercules on Oeta has also been questioned. Competence-bonus Effects for Female Leaders: Gender Roles, Affective Trust and Leader Effectiveness A Theory of Attribution Profiles and Employee (Dis) trust Reactions to Supervisor Justice Enactment
